season: Autumn always strong positive for decline. Spring decline has large range.
region: Stronger positive for GSL and MAB.
overall: Much clearer relationship for decline than onset.

season: Autumn and Winter slightly more positive with Spring decline usually negative.
region: Nothing clear. SS and NFS decline most often r ~= 0.
overall: Meh.

season: Spring is the only season that isn't mostly positive for decline.
region: SS is the only region not mostly positive for decline.
overall: Important for the decline of events, except often in Spring.

season: Autumn then Winter tend more positive.
region: MAB decline more positive than others.  GM GSL and MAB onset tend more positive.
overall: This value is all over the board. It likely only coincides with MHWs due to something else.

season: Spring then Summer strong negative onset. Autumn strong positive onset and decline.
region: GSL tends negative for decline while others tend positive. Very large ranges overall.
overall: There is an important signal in the differences between Spring-Summer and Autumn.

season: Large spread for all seasons with Autumn tending towards positive for onset and decline.
region: Not much difference. NFS tends a bit more towards positive onset and decline than others.
overall: There are some signals in there, but they are not clear.

season: Least amount of range in Autumn onset.
region: GM tends to have the least range and be the most negative for onset and decline.
overall: Slight positive onset and slight negative decline imply this vaguely shows a thermal gradient.

season: Autumn onset tends positive while everything else tends negative. Summer decline more negative.
region: GM and MAB tend more negative for decline.
overall: A smol signal for the GM and MAB showing decline negative with wind speed.

season: Spring onset tends most positive.
region: GM and NFS full tend more positive. MAB decline tends more positive.
overall: Meh.

season: Autumn onset tends much more positive. Spring decline tends more negative.
region: Large ranges in onset. GSL tends much more negative for decline.
overall: May be important for GSL events due to SWR importance there.

season: Autumn is much more negative for onset and decline. Spring and Summer onset tend positive.
region: GM and NFS more positive for decline.
overall: Decrease in MSLP is often important for the onset of events

decline: Strong positive with small negative tail
season: Full range in onset and decline for all seasons except positive Spring onset. Autumn onset tends negative.
region: Full range for all. GM decline tends positive. CBS onset tends negative, NFS and SS onset tend positive.
overall: Stronger signals than for MSLP non-cumulative.

season: Autumn onset and decline tend negative.
region: GM decline positive.
overall: The strong positive signal for decline implies a height anomaly (i.e. an eddy) leaving the area.

season: Not much difference. Winter onset tends more negative.
region: GM onset and decline tend more positive.
overall: Meh.

season: Autumn decline tends positive while Summer tends negative.
region: NFS onset tends most positive.
overall: Possibly something there for onset of events in NFS.

season: Autumn onset tends to be positive while everything else tends negative.
region: GSL decline tends much more negative while MAB decline tends positive.
overall: The positive decline for MAB implies the importance of advection for events.

season: Summer then Autumn tend more negative. Largest range on Winter.
region: GSL much more negative for onset+full+decline. CBS onset strong negative. GM decline strong negative.
overall: Strong negative mixed in with noise. Large differences between regions.

decline: Strong negative with minor positive tail
season: Strong negative decline for all but Summer. Summer onset negative with large Spring and Winter range.
region: Strong negative for all but CBA and SS with large range. All negative onset but large ranges.
overall: The decline of a MHW in Summer or the onset in Winter + Spring doesn’t seem as tied to MLD.

onset: Strong positive with minor negative tail
decline: Strong positive with small negative tail
season: Large ranges with strong positive Autumn onset.
region: Strong positive onset for MAB + GM. CBS decline tends negative.
overall: MHWs in Autumn generally have high bottom temps at onset

season: Very strong positive onset+full+decline for Autumn. Large range in onset+decline in Spring.
region: Strong positive onset for MAB.
overall: This variable is almost always important for onset and decline, especially in Autumn.

decline: Strong positive with minor negative tail
season: Strong positive onset for Autumn + Winter and negative for Spring + Summer.
region: Some difference in tendency but similar ranges for all regions.
overall: Very large differences in negative or positive correlations based on seasons.

onset: Strong positive with minor negative tail
season: Positive onset tendency with Autumn much stronger. Spring + Summer decline tend negative.
region: Strong positive onset for MAB + GM.
overall: Autumn may be significantly different from Spring.

season: Strong negative onset for Autumn. Large range for everything else.
region: Strong negative onset for GM but largest spread for MAB.
overall: A decrease in SWR in Autumn leads to MHWs, implying cloud cover or some other LHF mechanism.

decline: Strong positive with minor negative tail
season: Autumn has strongest positive onset+full+decline. Spring decline has large range with negative tendency.
region: MAB strong positive onset + decline. All others tend positive with larger range in decline for GM.
overall: All regions and seasons tend strong positive but with some notable outliers.
